qwen2.5.reason: Robert Scholes' primary area of study is not specifically science fiction studies. While he has written about science fiction, particularly in "Structural Fabulation," his work spans a wide range of topics including literary theory and criticism, modern media and culture, and the broader curriculum and relevance of humanities education. His expertise includes various forms of literature, cultural representation, and critical methodologies, making it inaccurate to restrict his primary area of study to science fiction studies alone.
